intro: Microtoena omeiensis, commonly known as the Omei mountain microtoena, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to mountainous climates. Its small, delicate leaves and clustered white flowers contribute to its unique botanical appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
